fields.name: clusters
fields.description: Returns a list of clusters that belong to this user.

fields.name: app
fields.description:
Returns an app with the specified version. If version has not been specified, it
returns the app with the latest version.

fields.name: apps
fields.description: Returns the latest version of each app.

fields.name: appVersions2
fields.description: Returns the list of versions of an app, optional filtered by labels

fields.name: discoverEndpointsFromCluster
fields.description: Discover endpoints from ClusterInfo.

args.name: seenBefore
args.description:
Returns policy compliance check result with the largest
timestamp smaller than this given timestamp.

args.name: clusterId
args.description: cluster to perform the query

args.name: reportType
args.description: Type of the policy compliance report to query

args.name: verbose
args.description:
Verbose level of the CROSS_NAMESPACE_COMMUNICATION report
Verbose level 1 indicates it only lists the cilium identity, which allow
ingress traffic from other namespaces
Verbose level 2 shows the full identity to identity list for all
namespaces.
Default verbose level is 1.

args.name: sourceNamespace
args.description:
We provide two filters for the three types of report.
For EGRESS_TO_WORLD, only sourceNamespace has an effect on the result.
For INGRESS_FROM_WORLD, only destinationNamespace has an effect on the result.
For CROSS_NAMESPACE_COMMUNICATION, both sourceNamespace and destinationNamespace
will have an effect on the result. If only one of the namespace, either sourceNamespace
or destinationNamespace, is specified, it'll filter accordingly.
source namespace filter

args.name: destinationNamespace
args.description: destination namespace filter

fields.name: securityStatusSummary
fields.description: Returns the number of entries in a security status report for each namespace.

args.name: seenBefore
args.description:
Returns security status summary with the largest timestamp smaller than
this given timestamp, or the latest summary if it's not specified. UTC is expected.

fields.name: securityStatusReport
fields.description: Returns security status report for a given namespace.

args.name: seenBefore
args.description:
Returns security status report with the largest timestamp smaller than
this given timestamp, or the latest report if it's not specified. UTC is expected.

fields.name: securityStatusDiffSummary
fields.description: Returns the number of entries in a security status diff report for each namespace.

args.name: seenBeforeFirst
args.description:
Timestamp of the first security status report to compare. This timestamp does not need to be the
exact timestamp of a securty status report. This query finds the security status report with the
largest timestamp smaller than this given timestamp. UTC is expected.

args.name: seenBeforeSecond
args.description:
Timestamp of the second security status report to compare. This timestamp does not need to be the
exact timestamp of a securty status report. This query finds the security status report with the
largest timestamp smaller than this given timestamp. UTC is expected.

fields.name: securityStatusDiff
fields.description: Returns security status diff report.

args.name: seenBeforeFirst
args.description:
Timestamp of the first security status report to compare. This timestamp does not need to be the
exact timestamp of a securty status report. This query finds the security status report with the
largest timestamp smaller than this given timestamp. UTC is expected.

args.name: seenBeforeSecond
args.description:
Timestamp of the second security status report to compare. This timestamp does not need to be the
exact timestamp of a securty status report. This query finds the security status report with the
largest timestamp smaller than this given timestamp. UTC is expected.

args.name: clusterID
args.description: Cluster id of the report.

args.name: reportType
args.description: Type of the security status report.

args.name: clusterId
args.description: cluster to perform the query

args.name: reportType
args.description: Type of the security status report.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns security status chart with a timestamp greater than this timestamp.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns security status chart with a timestamp less than this timestamp.

args.name: clusterId
args.description: cluster to perform the query.

args.name: reportType
args.description: Type of the security status report.

args.name: after
args.description: Returns security status chart with a timestamp greater than or equal to this timestamp.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns security status chart with a timestamp less than or equal to this timestamp.

args.name: namespace
args.description:
Namespace filter for security status chart. If the value is null, it will show the summation
of all namespaces.

fields.name: diffAppsVersions

fields.name: covalentPolicy

Returns covalent policy for a given app deployment input. This return type
is a list in case the app deployment spans multiple clusters.

fields.name: podMetadata

fields.name: tokens

fields.name: memberships

fields.name: org
fields.description: Returns currently selected organization, or null if none is selected.

order by timestamp ascending order.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
A timestamp formatted according to the IETF RFC 3339 Internet Date and Time Format
(https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6),
with the date and time separated by "T", e.g. "2017-05-10T11:35:00Z

types.name: SetAppInput
types.description: Input type for the setApp mutation.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: ID of the app. If this field is not set, the mutation creates a new app.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of the app.

inputFields.name: labels
inputFields.description: labels of the app version

inputFields.name: endpoints
inputFields.description: List of services.

inputFields.name: excludedLabelKeys
inputFields.description: List of endpoint label keys to exclude.

inputFields.name: nameLabelKey
inputFields.description: @deprecated(reason: "Use nameLabelKeys.")

inputFields.name: nameLabelKeys
inputFields.description:
Label to use as the endpoint name. The server looks for the name label
in the order specified in the list.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: ID of the endpoint. This is a hash of endpoint labels.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: name of the endpoint, ex: redis-master

inputFields.name: labels
inputFields.description: all labels for the endpoint

inputFields.name: protocols
inputFields.description: protocols of the endpoint

inputFields.name: disabled
inputFields.description: disabled or not

inputFields.name: v4Cidrs
inputFields.description: CIDRs for this endpoint.

inputFields.name: dnsName
inputFields.description: DNS name of the endpoint.

inputFields.name: icon
inputFields.description: name of an icon to use for displaying purposes

inputFields.name: cidr
inputFields.description: @deprecated(reason: "Use v4Cidrs/v6Cidrs.")

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

inputFields.name: l34Protocol
inputFields.description: L3/L4 Protocol, e.g. TCP/UDP/ICMP

inputFields.name: l7Protocol
inputFields.description:
Optional L7 specific fields
L7 protocol, e.g. HTTP. This field is set to null for L3/L4 only services.

inputFields.name: httpRewriteRules
inputFields.description: List of HTTP rewrite rules. This field is set to null for L3/L4 only services and non-HTTP services.

inputFields.name: functions
inputFields.description: List of functions provided by this service. This field is set to null for L3/L4 only services.

inputFields.name: applicationProtocol
inputFields.description:
Application-level protocol. For example, the user can set this field to "elasticsearch" to indicate that it's
elasticsearch that's running on this HTTP port.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Global ID. If this field is set, the server stores it as is. Otherwise it generates one.

inputFields.name: method
inputFields.description: Rewrite rule for HTTP methods, e.g. "^GET$"

inputFields.name: path
inputFields.description: Rewrite rule for HTTP request path, e.g. "^/jobs/([0-9]+)$".

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: e.g. "^GET /jobs/[0-9]+$" (comes from flow name)

inputFields.name: allowedSources
inputFields.description: List of source endpoint that are allowed to call this function.

inputFields.name: disabled
inputFields.description: If this field is set to true, this function is excluded from the app model.

enumValues.name: OUTSIDE_MANAGED
enumValues.description: Endpoint does not belong to the app, but is managed by Cilium.

enumValues.name: SOURCE_RESERVED_WORLD
enumValues.description: Source "reserved:world" endpoint.

enumValues.name: CIDR_ALLOW_ALL
enumValues.description: The default /0 CIDR endpoint for CIDR destinations.

enumValues.name: DNS
enumValues.description: DNS-based endpoint.

enumValues.name: INBOUND
enumValues.description: discover only flows that goes ingress to app deployment from outside

enumValues.name: OUTBOUND
enumValues.description: discover only flows that goes egress from app deployment to outside

enumValues.name: INTRA_APP
enumValues.description: discover only flows within app deployment boundaries

fields.name: baseApp
fields.description: base app version, which was used for discovery

fields.name: discoveredApp
fields.description: new app version, which was created as a result of discovery, based on baseApp

fields.name: discoveredAppHash
fields.description:
Hash of all the endpoints in discoveredApp. This can be used to detect when there is any change in the
discoveredApp.

fields.name: changes
fields.description: list of changes between base app version and discovered

fields.name: outsiders
fields.description: App ID / name of OUTSIDE_MANAGED endpoints.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the app.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the app, e.g. Covalent.io.

fields.name: labels
fields.description: Labels of the app

fields.name: version
fields.description: Version of the app.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Created at timestamp

fields.name: endpoints
fields.description: List of endpoints.

fields.name: excludedLabelKeys
fields.description: List of endpoint label keys to exclude.

fields.name: nameLabelKey
fields.description: @deprecated(reason: "Use nameLabelKeys.")

fields.name: nameLabelKeys
fields.description:
Label to use as the endpoint name. The server looks for the name label
in the order specified in the list.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the endpoint. This is a hash of endpoint labels.

fields.name: name
fields.description: name of the endpoint, ex: redis-master

fields.name: labels
fields.description: all labels for the endpoint

fields.name: protocols
fields.description: Protocols supported by this endpoint.

fields.name: disabled
fields.description: If this field is set to true, this endpoint is excluded from the app model.

fields.name: v4Cidrs
fields.description:
CIDRs for this endpoint. These fields take precedence over the labels field, meaning if either of the cidrs lists is
not empty, the endpoint is defined based on CIDRs and the labels field should be ignored. Note that these fields will
be required once migration from the cidr field is complete.

fields.name: dnsName
fields.description: DNS name of the endpoint.

fields.name: icon
fields.description: name of an icon to use for displaying purposes

fields.name: cidr
fields.description: @deprecated(reason: "Use v4Cidrs/v6Cidrs.")

fields.name: id
fields.description: id of a protocol, hash

fields.name: l34Protocol
fields.description: L3/L4 Protocol, e.g. TCP/UDP/ICMP

fields.name: allowedSources
fields.description:
List of source endpoints that are allowed to access this service. If this field is set, the service is assumed to be
L3/L4 only. For services that have L7 information, this field is set to null.

fields.name: port
fields.description:
Optional L4 specific field
ex: 9080

fields.name: l7Protocol
fields.description:
Optional L7 specific fields
L7 protocol, e.g. HTTP. This field is set to null for L3/L4 only services.

fields.name: httpRewriteRules
fields.description: List of HTTP rewrite rules. This field is set to null for L3/L4 only services and non-HTTP services.

fields.name: functions
fields.description: List of functions provided by this service. This field is set to null for L3/L4 only services.

fields.name: applicationProtocol
fields.description:
Application-level protocol. For example, the user can set this field to "elasticsearch" to indicate that it's
elasticsearch that's running on this HTTP port.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Global ID.

fields.name: method
fields.description: Rewrite rule for HTTP methods, e.g. "^GET$"

fields.name: path
fields.description: Rewrite rule for HTTP request path, e.g. "^/jobs/([0-9]+)$".

fields.name: id
fields.description: id of function, hash

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the function, e.g. "^GET /jobs/[0-9]+$".

fields.name: allowedSources
fields.description: List of source endpoints that are allowed to call this function.

fields.name: disabled
fields.description: If this field is set to true, this function is excluded from the app model.

types.name: OutsiderEndpoint
types.description: Information about an endpoint that doesn't belong to the current app.

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Page information for a connection object.

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: Indicates whether there is a next page in the connection.

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: Indicates whether there is a previous page in the connection.

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: A cursor that points to the first element in the page.

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: A cursor that points to the last element in the page.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The name of the RBAC role.
e.g. "db-admins"

fields.name: user
fields.description:
The subject of the RBAC role.
e.g. "alice" or "bob"

fields.name: org
fields.description: The domain of the RBAC role.

types.name: RbacPolicyRulesConnection
types.description: Connection object for RBAC policy rules.

types.name: RbacPolicyRulesEdge
types.description: Edge object for RBAC policy rules.

fields.name: user
fields.description:
The subject of the RBAC policy rule. This can be a user, or a role name.
e.g. "alice" or "db-admins"

fields.name: org
fields.description:
The domain of the RBAC policy rule.
e.g. "covalent"

fields.name: object
fields.description:
The object of the RBAC policy rule. This is the resource whose access is being controlled.
e.g. "troubleshooting-flows" or "clusters" or "orgs"

fields.name: action
fields.description: The action of the RBAC policy rule.

fields.name: effect
fields.description: The effect of the RBAC policy rule.

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID of the cluster.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the cluster.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type of the cluster.

fields.name: namespaces
fields.description: Namespaces in this cluster.

fields.name: connectInstructions
fields.description: Instructions for connecting a user cluster to covalent.io.

fields.name: k8sConfigFile
fields.description: Kubernetes YAML file to create all the components.

fields.name: agentUpgradeInfo
fields.description: (Optional) Agent upgrade information

fields.name: exporterUpgradeInfo
fields.description: (Optional) Exporter upgrade information

fields.name: status
fields.description: (Optional) Information about the status of the cluster.

fields.name: unmanagedPods
fields.description: List of pods that are not managed by cilium

fields.name: token
fields.description: Access token for the cluster.

fields.name: cnp
fields.description:
List of Cilium network policies in this cluster. You can optionally specify a namespace
to limit the results to CNPs in the namespace.

fields.name: cep
fields.description: List of Cilium Endpoints.

fields.name: defaultBaselinePolicyId
fields.description:
The ID of the default baseline policy associated with this cluster.
This baseline policy will be applied to any namespace
that does not feature in namespaceBaselinePolicyAssignment.

fields.name: defaultBaselinePolicyVersion
fields.description: The version of the baseline policy.

fields.name: namespaceBaselinePolicyAssignment
fields.description:
Information about the baseline policies applied to namespaces in this cluster.
Namespaces that do not appear here are subject to the defaultBaselinePolicy.

fields.name: isUpgradeNeeded
fields.description: Boolean to indicate need for an upgrade

fields.name: reason
fields.description: The reason for the upgrade decision

fields.name: currentVersion
fields.description: The current version

fields.name: latestVersion
fields.description: (optional) The latest version available

fields.name: upgradeInstructions
fields.description: (optional) Instructions to upgrade

fields.name: ciliumNetworkPolicies
fields.description:
Status of the component. Some components, such as components of type K8S_CONTROLLER
can have multiple associated K8S_PODS, each having their own status. This is the reason
status is an unordered list of ClusterComponentStatus objects.

types.name: CiliumNetworkPolicyStatus
types.description: CiliumNetworkPolicyStatus represents status of each cilium network policy

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the cilium network policy.

fields.name: error
fields.description: (optional) Error message. This field is set to null if the status is not ERROR.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the policy.

fields.name: hostname
fields.description: Name of the node e.g. minikube where the pod is running.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: Name of the namespace where this policy has been appied.

fields.name: desiredVersion
fields.description: (optional) The desired cilium network policy version.

fields.name: currentVersion
fields.description: (optional) The current cilium network policy version.

types.name: PodStatus
types.description: PodStatus represents status of each K8s pod

fields.description: Status of the pod.

fields.name: error
fields.description: (optional) Error message. This field is set to null if the status is not ERROR.

fields.name: hostname

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: Name of the namespace where this policy has been appied.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the Pod.

fields.name: hostNetwork
fields.description: True if the pod is running in host networking mode.

fields.name: version
fields.description: Software version of the pod.

fields.name: ipv6Addresses

fields.name: logMessage

fields.name: failingControllers

fields.description: Number of consecutive controller failures

fields.name: failureCount

fields.name: lastFailureMsg

fields.name: lastFailureTimestamp

The ID of the baseline policy. Optional.
If set to null, it implies that this namespace will not
be assigned any baseline policy, including default.

fields.name: policyVersion

types.description: SecurityStatusChartSegments is a list of CountSegments with the associated legend.

fields.description: Name of the app deployment

fields.name: appId
fields.description: Application model ID

fields.name: appVersion
fields.description: Revision of the application that were used to create policy for the application deployment

fields.name: appPolicyId
fields.description: Enforced app policy id

fields.name: appPolicyVersion
fields.description: Enforced app policy version

fields.name: boundary
fields.description:
Boundary of the app deployment. Boundary of an app deployment is defined by a list of clusters
and namespaces within each cluster.

fields.name: labelMapping
fields.description: label mapping

fields.name: excludedLabelKeys
fields.description: exclude labels

fields.name: policyOptions
fields.description: Policy Options

fields.name: endpointSelectorLabelKeys
fields.description:
list of endpoints selectors labels keys to whitelist for policy generation,
Policy manager uses all the labels if the list is empty.

fields.name: ingressPolicyMode
fields.description: Policy mode for ingress rules. Set it to NONE to disable ingress rules altogether.

fields.name: allowIngressFrom
fields.description: Allows ingress traffic from the selected endpoints in addition to ingress rules specified in the app model.

fields.name: egressPolicyMode
fields.description: Policy mode for egress rules. Set it to NONE to disable egress rules altogether.

fields.name: allowEgressTo
fields.description: Allows egress traffic to the selected endpoints in addition to egress rules specified in the app model.

enumValues.name: L7_VISIBILITY
enumValues.description:
Enables Cilium L7 proxy without any L7 rules to allow any traffic to it. Used for
"L7 visibility" mode.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of application deployments

inputFields.name: appId
inputFields.description: ID of the app

inputFields.name: appVersion
inputFields.description: Version of the app

inputFields.name: appPolicyId
inputFields.description: Policy id to enforce

inputFields.name: appPolicyVersion
inputFields.description: Policy version to enforce

inputFields.name: boundary
inputFields.description: Boundary of the app deployment

inputFields.name: labelMapping
inputFields.description: label mapping

inputFields.name: excludedLabelKeys
inputFields.description: exclude labels

inputFields.name: policyOptions
inputFields.description: Defines how policy will be generated for the app deployment

types.name: SelectorInput
types.description: Set matchLabels to select endpoints, or entity to select an entity (e.g. "world", "host", or "all").

fields.name: appModelInfo
fields.description:
This field contains app model specific information, and is set if flows are filtered
by AppEndpointFilterInput.

types.name: RejectedReason
types.description:
Hand-picked collection of reasons that are exposed to the UI for advanced filtering.
All possible values: https://github.com/cilium/cilium/blob/master/pkg/monitor/api/drop.go#L27

types.name: AppModelInfo
types.description: App model specific information about a flow.

inputFields.name: clusterId
inputFields.description:
Returns flows observed in this cluster. This field is mutually exclusive with the
deploymentId field.

inputFields.name: deploymentId
inputFields.description:
Returns flows observed in this deployment. This field is mutually exclusive with
the clusterId field.

inputFields.name: after
inputFields.description: Returns flows with a timestamp greater than this timestamp.

inputFields.name: before
inputFields.description: Returns flows with a timestamp less than this timestamp.

inputFields.name: forwardingStatus
inputFields.description: Returns flows if the forwarding status matches.

inputFields.name: rejectedReason
inputFields.description: More granular filtering for rejected flows with specific reasons.

inputFields.name: sourceLabels
inputFields.description: Filter flows by source endpoint labels.

inputFields.name: destinationLabels
inputFields.description: Filter flows by destination endpoint labels.

inputFields.name: labels
inputFields.description:
Filter flows by source or destination endpoints. This filter option returns flows
whose source or destination endpoint labels match the provided labels.

inputFields.name: excludeLabels
inputFields.description: Filter out flows by source or destination endpoints, which labels contains the specified labels.

inputFields.name: sourceIpAddress
inputFields.description: Filter flows by source IP address.

inputFields.name: destinationIpAddress
inputFields.description: Filter flows by destination IP address.

inputFields.name: destinationDnsName
inputFields.description: Filter flows by destination DNS name.

inputFields.name: sourceSecurityId
inputFields.description: Filter flows by source seccurity ID.

inputFields.name: destinationSecurityId
inputFields.description: Filter flows by destination seccurity ID.

inputFields.name: endpointId
inputFields.description:
Filter flows by endpoint ID of an app model. This filter returns flows that matches
either source or destination endpoint ID.

inputFields.name: destinationPort
inputFields.description: Filter flows by destination port.

inputFields.name: interappTraffic
inputFields.description: Filter interapp flows

inputFields.name: inboundTraffic
inputFields.description: Filter inbound flows

inputFields.name: outboundTraffic
inputFields.description: Filter outbound flows

inputFields.name: crossNamespaceOnly
inputFields.description: If set true, only show flows where source namespace is not equal destination namespace

inputFields.name: appId
inputFields.description: Application model ID

inputFields.name: appVersion
inputFields.description: Application model version

inputFields.name: endpointId
inputFields.description: Application endpoint ID

Defines a single Cilium network policy spec.

types.description: Defines a single ingress rule for Cilium network policy.

Entities used by Cilium network policies:

fields.name: toFQDNs
fields.description:
If this field is set, toEndpoints and toEntities fields are ignored since
toFQDNs egress rules cannot contain any other L3 selectors.
https://docs.cilium.io/en/latest/policy/language/#dns-based

types.name: CNPFQDNSelector
types.description:
FQDN selector for toFQDNs egress rules. Either matchName or matchPattern field
must be set, but not both. https://docs.cilium.io/en/latest/policy/language/#dns-based

policy.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

fields.name: name
fields.description: user defined name of the integration

fields.description: id of a cluster

fields.name: reports

fields.description: if true - report will be generated for all namespaces

fields.name: namespaces
fields.description: if allNamespaces is false - report will be generated for the following namespaces

fields.name: baseApp

fields.name: discoveredApp

fields.name: discoveredAppHash

Hash of all the endpoints in discoveredApp. This can be used to detect when there is any change in the
discoveredApp.

fields.name: newAppEndpoints

fields.name: newAppProtocols
fields.description: list of ID's of new app protocols that were discovered

fields.name: newFunctions

fields.name: removedAppEndpoints

fields.name: newAllowedSources
fields.description: list of l34 flows, which were used during discovery

fields.name: appL7Flows
fields.description: list of l7 flows, which were used during discovery

fields.name: changes
fields.description: list of changes between base app version and discovered

fields.name: outsiders
fields.description: App ID / name of OUTSIDE_MANAGED endpoints.

enumValues.description: L4

enumValues.name: L7
enumValues.description: L7 ingress only

fields.name: appId
fields.description: App associated with this cluster.

fields.name: appVersion
fields.description: Version of the app associated with this cluster.

fields.name: namespaces
fields.description: Namespaces used for visibility.

fields.name: visibilityRuleMode
fields.description: Visibility rule mode. Defaults to L7.

types.name: IngressRuleMode
types.description: Ingress rule modes for enforcement policies.

fields.name: appId
fields.description: App associated with this cluster.

fields.name: appVersion
fields.description: Version of the app associated with this cluster.

fields.name: namespace
namespaceMapping
fields.description:
Mapping from namespaces in the app model to namespaces to enforce
Cilium policy in. If the namespace is not found in the mapping, the
corresponding enforcement rule defaults to the namespace in the app
model.

fields.name: ingressRuleMode
fields.description:
Ingress rule mode. Defaults to L7.
TODO(michi) Make this field required.

types.name: NamespaceMapping
types.description:
Mapping from namespaces in an app model to namespaces to enforce
Cilium policy in.

fields.name: from
fields.description: Namespace in an app model.

fields.name: to
fields.description: Corresponding namespace to enforce policy in.

inputFields.name: appId
inputFields.description: App associated with this cluster.

inputFields.name: appVersion
inputFields.description: Version of the app associated with this cluster.

inputFields.name: namespace
inputFields.description: @deprecated(reason: "Use namespaceMapping instead.") Namespace for enforcing

inputFields.name: namespaceMapping
inputFields.description:
Mapping from namespaces in the app model to namespaces to enforce
Cilium policy in.

inputFields.name: ingressRuleMode
inputFields.description: Ingress rule mode. Defaults to L7.

types.name: L7AggregationPolicyStatus
types.description: L7AggregationPolicyStatus represents status of each L7 aggregation policy.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the L7 aggregation policy.

fields.name: error
fields.description: (optional) Error message. This field is set to null if the status is not ERROR.

fields.name: desiredVersion
fields.description: (optional) The desired L7 aggregation policy version.

fields.name: currentVersion
fields.description: (optional) The current L7 aggregation policy version.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: Namespace this KNP belongs to.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the KNP.

fields.name: creationTimestamp
fields.description: Timestamp at which this KNP was created.

fields.name: yaml
fields.description: The full KNP in YAML format.

fields.name: excludedNamespaces
fields.description: Namespaces to exclude from applying the baseline policy.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
